description: This module provides functions for performing FTP commands.

functions.name: connect-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($uri as string, $options as object()) as anyURI
functions.description: Attempts to connect to an FTP server specified by the given URI.
functions.summary: Attempts to connect to an FTP server specified by the given URI.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The address of the FTP server to connect to. It may either be simple host-name (ftp.example.com) or a URI using the ftp or ftps (FTP over SSL/TLS) schemes (ftp://ftp.example.com). If the latter, the URI may also contain username, password, and port authority subcomponents per RFC 3986.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
The options to use:
user
The user to log in as; default: "ftp" (for anonymous FTP). If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the user, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
password
The password to use to log in; default: "ftp@example.com" (for anonymous FTP). If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the password, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
port
The port number to use; default: whatever the default for the protocol is. If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the port, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
protocol
The protocol to use, either "ftp' or "ftps"; default: "ftp". If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the protocol, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
SSL-communication
Whether to use SSL/TLS, one of:
"none"
Don't use SSL.
"try"
Try using SSL, but, if unsuccessful, continue anyway.
"control"
Require SSL for the control connection.
"all"
Require SSL for all communication.
default: "none" for protocol "ftp" and "all" for protocol "ftps". Note that any value other than "none" for "ftp" implies explicit SSL; use of "ftps" implies implicit SSL. See "Methods of invoking security."
SSL-verify
When doing FTP over SSL/TLS, whether to verify the authenticity of the server's certificate and that the certificate is for that server; default: true. (You should never set this to false unless you are testing your own FTP server with a self-signed certificate.)
trace
Whether to emit information to standard error tracing the communication between the FTP client and server; default: false.

returns.description: an opaque URI that serves as a connection handle to be used with other functions in this module.

errors: ftp:ALREADY_CONNECTED if $uri is already connected to.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any option is invalid.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: connect
functions.signature: ($uri as string, $options as object()) as anyURI external
functions.description: Attempts to connect to an FTP server specified by the given URI.
functions.summary: Attempts to connect to an FTP server specified by the given URI.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The address of the FTP server to connect to. It may either be simple host-name (ftp.example.com) or a URI using the ftp or ftps (FTP over SSL/TLS) schemes (ftp://ftp.example.com). If the latter, the URI may also contain username, password, and port authority subcomponents per RFC 3986.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
The options to use:
user
The user to log in as; default: "ftp" (for anonymous FTP). If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the user, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
password
The password to use to log in; default: "ftp@example.com" (for anonymous FTP). If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the password, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
port
The port number to use; default: whatever the default for the protocol is. If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the port, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
protocol
The protocol to use, either "ftp' or "ftps"; default: "ftp". If $uri is actually a URI instead of a simple host-name, the protocol, if specified, must be part of the URI and the value of this option is ignored.
SSL-communication
Whether to use SSL/TLS, one of:
"none"
Don't use SSL.
"try"
Try using SSL, but, if unsuccessful, continue anyway.
"control"
Require SSL for the control connection.
"all"
Require SSL for all communication.
default: "none" for protocol "ftp" and "all" for protocol "ftps". Note that any value other than "none" for "ftp" implies explicit SSL; use of "ftps" implies implicit SSL. See "Methods of invoking security."
SSL-verify
When doing FTP over SSL/TLS, whether to verify the authenticity of the server's certificate and that the certificate is for that server; default: true. (You should never set this to false unless you are testing your own FTP server with a self-signed certificate.)
trace
Whether to emit information to standard error tracing the communication between the FTP client and server; default: false.

returns.description: an opaque URI that serves as a connection handle to be used with other functions in this module.

errors: ftp:ALREADY_CONNECTED if $uri is already connected to.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if any option is invalid.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: delete
functions.signature: ($conn as string, $remote-path as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Deletes a file from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Deletes a file from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to delete.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-binary-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as base64Binary
functions.description: Gets a binary file from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a binary file from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-binary
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as base64Binary external
functions.description: Gets a binary file from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a binary file from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-text-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as string
functions.description: Gets a text file, presumed to be encoded in UTF-8, from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a text file, presumed to be encoded in UTF-8, from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get. It must not be empty.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-text-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string, $encoding as string) as string
functions.description: Gets a text file from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a text file from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get. It must not be empty.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The character encoding of the file.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty or $encoding is either an invalid or unsupported encoding.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-text
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as string
functions.description: Gets a text file, presumed to be encoded in UTF-8, from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a text file, presumed to be encoded in UTF-8, from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get. It must not be empty.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: get-text
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string, $encoding as string) as string external
functions.description: Gets a text file from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a text file from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to get. It must not be empty.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The character encoding of the file.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty or $encoding is either an invalid or unsupported encoding.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: list-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as object()*
functions.description: Gets a listing for a directory on an FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a listing for a directory on an FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The full path of the directory on the FTP server to get the directory listing for. An empty path is equivalent to /.

returns.description: Returns a sequence of JSON objects, one per file or subdirectory in the listing.

errors: ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: list
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $remote-path as string) as object()* external
functions.description: Gets a listing for a directory on an FTP server.
functions.summary: Gets a listing for a directory on an FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The full path of the directory on the FTP server to get the directory listing for. An empty path is equivalent to /.

returns.description: Returns a sequence of JSON objects, one per file or subdirectory in the listing.

errors: ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mkdir
functions.signature: ($conn as string, $remote-path as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Creates a directory on the FTP server.
functions.summary: Creates a directory on the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the new directory to create.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: put-binary
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $binary as base64Binary, $remote-path as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Uploads binary data to a file to the FTP server.
functions.summary: Uploads binary data to a file to the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: binary
parameters.description: The binary data to upload.

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to upload to. It must not be empty.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: put-text
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $text as string, $remote-path as string) as empty-sequence()
functions.description: Uploads text to a UTF-8 encoded file on the FTP server.
functions.summary: Uploads text to a UTF-8 encoded file on the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to upload.

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to upload to. It must not be empty.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: put-text
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $text as string, $remote-path as string, $encoding as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Uploads text to a file to the FTP server.
functions.summary: Uploads text to a file to the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to upload.

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the file to upload to. It must not be empty.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The character encoding of the file.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty or $encoding is either an invalid or unsupported encoding.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rename
functions.signature: ($conn as string, $remote-from-path as string, $remote-to-path as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Renames a file or directory on an FTP server.
functions.summary: Renames a file or directory on an FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-from-path
parameters.description: The path of the file or directory to rename.

parameters.name: remote-to-path
parameters.description: The new name.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-from-path or $remote-to-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rmdir
functions.signature: ($conn as string, $remote-path as string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: Removes a directory from the FTP server.
functions.summary: Removes a directory from the FTP server.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The opaque URI connection handle previously returned by ftp:connect().

parameters.name: remote-path
parameters.description: The path of the directory to remove.

errors: ftp:INVALID_ARGUMENT if $remote-path is empty.
ftp:NOT_CONNECTED if $conn is either an invalid handle or is no longer a valid handle.
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ftp:FTP_ERROR if there was some other FTP error.</xqdoc:error>
